intro: Boechera ultraalsa, commonly known as the Sierra Point bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This herbaceous perennial typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, white or pale blue flowers bloom in clusters, adding a delicate touch to its rugged habitat. The plant's leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette and contributing to its distinctive appearance.
